description.narrative:
Ethiopian Humanitarian Country Team (EHCT), recognizing the slow-onset natural disaster caused by global EI Niño phenomena, has significantly ramped up internal efforts to respond to the needs of people. The Government of Ethiopia so far has collected 4 Billion Ethiopian Birr (USD 192 Million) and has taken the lead to respond to food and non-food requirements. The fore, the Ethiopia Humanitarian Country team (EHCT) calls for increased engagement from the International Donor community to meet these aims. Even though, Ethiopia's GPD is regressively progressing in which the agriculture sector is assumed to be jumped from 6.0% to 11% together with improving the past image of the country, unpredictable challenge of seasonal food shortage occurred. The Mid- year review of Ethiopian Humanitarian Requirements Documents (HRD) issued in April 2016, noted increases in humanitarian need across several lifesaving sectors, notably food assistance, Targeted Supplementary Food (TSF), nutrition, access to potable water and deaths, destroying livelihoods and contributing to food insecurity. Similarly, agriculture and livelihoods official reports have sharply raised this figure to a total of 8.2 million in the need of emergency assistance at national level; The Federal Government of Ethiopia council approve DRMFSS request to move the annual meher assessment from November to October to ensure that all needful communities are quickly included and help form the basis of the government's led interagency HRD for 2016. Factors contributing to the current crisis are the failed spring belg rains coupled with late, erratic and uneven summer Kiremt rains that are below normal adversely affecting the food security situation.
The project was set-up as part of ETJR II, a consortium of Dutch NGOs getting funding of MOFA with WVI as lead. On the project: the focus and priorities do address those areas of highest need, also the interventions match with priorities as set by DRA. The project is of good quality, sufficient details are provided on number of outputs and beneficiaries. Also additional explanations on gender, downward accountability and capacity building have been given in the proposal. We worked with EECMY during 2011-2012 humanitarian response with good results. So we know this project is of good quality and with a good implementer, so we can proceed with e.g. pre-financing and contracting.

Since the beginning of 2015, the Government of Ethiopia has been conducting assessments on food security and availability on a quarterly basis through the country. Based on HRD 2016 and further needs assessments by the two partners of ICCO/Act Alliance, EECMY and Hundee, the program focuses on strategic objective 1 of the HRD by providing emergency food aid to save lives and reduce morbidity related to drought. The HRD 2016 targets 10,2 million people for food assistance .

activity-description.narrative: Food distribution, heifers , small ruminants , quick maturing seeds, shallow well rehabilitation and trainng on DRR
